main event: On 23 August 1953, a civilian reported a sighting of an unidentified object that appeared as a cloud formation in Port Moresby, New Guinea.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20 minutes and was noted for the object being stationary and appearing larger than typical cloud formations., A movie camera was used to attempt to capture the sighting, although results were pending., Air Traffic Control had no records of aircraft movements in the area at the time of the sighting., The weather conditions were reported as clear, with no known natural or man-made objects that could account for the sighting., The object was described as potentially being a high-speed aircraft due to its unusual movement.
witness description: a civilian who observed the object and reported it to authorities
